subject: Sales
title: John H. Patterson: Father of Modern Sales
description: A 60-second lesson on John H. Patterson: Father of Modern Sales.

hook.text: Before Patterson, salespeople had no training, no territories, no quotas. Just charm and chaos.

buildup.text: In 1884 he bought National Cash Register and invented the modern sales organization from scratch.

discovery.text: He created the first sales script, the first training school, and the first guaranteed territory.

twist.text: His methods were so dominant the government sued NCR for antitrust violations. Success bred suspicion.

climax.text: Every structured sales team today traces its roots to one man in Dayton, Ohio.

punchline.text: Modern sales was invented by a cash register salesman.

quiz.question: What did John H. Patterson create for the first time in sales?
